intro: Mystacidium caffrum, commonly known as the African mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on various host trees in sub-Saharan Africa. Mystacidium caffrum is often found in woodland and forested areas, contributing to the ecological dynamics of its habitat.
